author: Async
title: Help University/hacker association
description: An incentive to use Cardano has to be created for groups that are creating and experimenting with new technologies.

assessments.note: The proposal might help to get more people on board of the Cardano-train, there is no plan to solve specific issues for local communities.

Hackatons are a great way to explore the potential of ADA and to develop new software in a limited timeframe.
This proposal in particular has a good chance of introducing a lot of technologically literate people to Cardano.

Unfortunately, this proposal does not address the challenge as stated in the campaign brief.  The idea of a hackathon is good and I want to encourage the proposer.  For instance, when a commenter mentioned another hackathon for blockchain technology, the proposer said they would reach out and refine the proposal.  This idea would be PERFECT as an activity in an LCC.

The proposal presents some promising ideas, I believe Hackathons are an interesting model of engaging more people in the Cardano ecosystem, but the proposal presented is not aligned with the challenge, the proposal doesn't focus on the proposed challenge. I recommend that the proposer submits his idea in an appropriate challenge.

There is experience as developer but for the things that are planned. There is no information on the qualifications regarding the organisation of the events and establishing a good relation with universities.
The proposal is very broad in the sense of which universities and associations it wants to target.
There are many good details about the actual hackathon, such as the first challenge.  That's great!  But, there is no mention of itemized milestones, definition of success, nor challenges considered.

The plan is not well structured, there are good ideas but the presentation can be improved. I recommend that the proposer use the default template present in the Catalyst documentation to structure the proposal and provide the necessary details for the elaboration of an objective plan. I recommend that the proposer insert more details about his professional experiences and qualifications and a link to his LinkedIn.
The way to success is quite vague, as the whole proposal ist vague.

The plan is good, but could be better if accompanied by a roadmap.
Be clear as to what portion of the fund will go to webdesign and rewards.

This proposer obviously spent quality time on this proposal and has, in my opinion, good insights.  However, the connection between a Hackathon and creating an LCC (Local Community Center) is not made explicit in the proposal.  Because there is no roadmap / timeline / deliverables, I can not assess how feasible it is.  It is obvious that the proposer has experience with Hackathons but it is not clear the amount of experience nor the nature of that experience.  I'd like to know if they have organized a Hackathon before and how they measure success of hackathon.

The proposal described doesn't address the challenge in a relevant way, there is no mention of Community centers. Some important information need to be included so that we can evaluate the viability of the proposal, such as KPIs, budget allocation details and details about the experience and qualification of the proposer. I recommend that the proposer follow the Guidelines and Catalyst documentation to develop a new proposal and put it in an appropriate challenge.

solution: Provide useful real case examples and hints to use Cardano. Those hints can be used for hackathons and university groups/projects.
